For the discontented sixteen-year-old Celia (Barclay) he opens up a world she has only dreamed of. She actively pursues a friendship with him, fascinated by his cynicism and experience of the world beyond her small-town existence. But many, including the members of both their families (Otto, Moy), frown upon the friendship and when Celia goes missing, Paul becomes the increasingly loathed and persecuted prime suspect in her disappearance. As the violent and urgent truth gradually emerges, Paul is forced to confront the family tragedy and betrayal that he ran from as a youth, and to face the grievous consequences of silence and secrecy that has surrounded his entire adult life.","popularity":9.87,"poster_path":"/tnFvXenEmwfESsw401SE6N9oFQp.jpg","release_date":"2004-06-11","title":"In My Father's Den","video":false,"vote_average":7.0,"vote_count":94},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/lUUB7fPMx5bNYpE1ePoKlO8eaKj.jpg","genre_ids":[18],"id":1162,"original_language":"en","original_title":"The Miracle Worker","overview":"The true story of the frightening, lonely world of silence and darkness of 7-year-old Helen Keller who, since infancy, has never seen the sky, heard her mother's voice or expressed her innermost feelings.
